Name: Hooked on Trouble
Description: You may catch more than just fish when out at sea...
QuestDesc: You may catch more than just fish when out at sea...

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, what am I to do now... I need help, and I need it quickly!

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Just thinking about it makes me shudder! I was minding my own business, fishing away, when I reeled in something downright bizarre.

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our eyes met for a heartbeat before it lunged at me! Took me right back to when I was a boy, the day I got off from school and came across... oh, the terror!

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was by the beach over there. It was some kind of ghostly bird with a mask... Terrifying, I tell you! I didn't know I was fishing for feathered fiends...

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's still wandering about over there. I daren't go fishing now...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So he reeled in a Fae Ignis. I'd better get rid of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's done. I should tell David it's safe now.

Options.PlotLineKey: It was just a Fae Ignis.

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Fae Ignis! Never thought I'd catch a TD...

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When my rod took a nosedive, I thought I had hooked a whopper!

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I can't thank you enough for dealing with that beast! Please, take these as a token of my gratitude.

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh, huh. With that beast gone, I'll keep fishing!

Options.PlotLineKey: You won't try your luck in a new spot?

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, not to worry. I've already said my prayers. This is my lucky spot today.

Dialogues.Speaker: David
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll have a fine fish in my bag when all is said and done. Now, off to the beach with me!
